snippet: The book, a 186-page investigation of donations made to the Clinton Foundation by foreign entities, is proving the most anticipated and feared book of a presidential cycle still in its infancy.
abstract: Peter Schweizer book Clinton Cash: The Untold Story of How and Why Foreign Governments and Businesses Helped Make Bill and Hillary Rich will be published in May, and is most anticipated book of presidential cycle; book purports to show how entities that made payments to Clinton Foundation received favors from State Dept under Hillary Clinton.
lead_paragraph: The book, a 186-page investigation of donations made to the Clinton Foundation by foreign entities, is proving the most anticipated and feared book of a presidential cycle still in its infancy.

headline.main: New Book, ‘Clinton Cash,’ Questions Foreign Donations to Foundation

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Clinton Cash: The Untold Story of How and Why Foreign Governments and Businesses Helped Make Bill and Hillary Rich (Book)
